title: Ultra-Easy Cheesecake Made in a Rice Cooker
directions: 1Bring the cream cheese to room temperature or heat it up in a little in the microwave, and mix well to soften.
2Add the eggs, sugar, and lemon juice and mix. Add the heavy cream and flour bit by bit while mixing well. You can also use a food processor to speed up the process.
3Pour the batter into a rice cooker and switch on! (Tip: For a smooth texture, strain through a sieve to remove any lumps).
4It is done once you stick it with a toothpick and it comes out clean (cook for longer if it's still not cooked enough).
5The cake is really soft and delicate when hot, so remove the rice cooker bowl from the machine, and cover with plastic wrap. Leave to cool. Transfer to a plate once it cools to room temperature.
6To flip the cake without crumbling it, place a small plate that fits inside the pot - or use your hand if you don't have a plate like that. Lightly press down on the cake, then flip it over.
7Chill the cake well in the refrigerator, and it's done! You can have fun with this by pouring fruit sauce over the cake and varying it in other ways.

8When using a 3 cup rice cooker, the cake will be have more height than the 5-cup version, so it may not cook through in one cooking cycle. Try cooking the cake for a longer time or halving the ingredients.
9This cake freezes well. Tightly wrap with plastic wrap, place into a zip-type plastic bag, press out the air, and freeze.
